definition: thick/deep or profound/kind/generous/rich or strong in flavor/to favor/to stress

sentences.english: And we had the cheek to call the Taliban vandals.
sentences.chinese: 而我们还曾厚颜无耻地称塔利班为野蛮人。

sentences.english: It is the most impudent piece of pretension I ever heard of in my life.
sentences.chinese: 这是我一生中从没听说过的最厚颜无耻的一项要求了。

sentences.english: To tell a barefaced lie to your friends will create bad relationships.
sentences.chinese: 告诉朋友厚颜无耻的谎言，将会造成不良的关系。

sentences.english: And the site's cheeky bravado rubs salt in the wounds.
sentences.chinese: 并且网站厚颜无耻并自信满满地往它们的伤口上撒盐。

sentences.english: It illustrated the thuggeryand brazenness of the state machine.
sentences.chinese: 这很好地诠释了这个国家机器的暗箱操作和厚颜无耻。

sentences.english: One could only gasp at the sheer effrontery of the man.
sentences.chinese: 那人十足的厚颜无耻让人们吃惊得无话可说。

sentences.english: Ignorance is the mother of impudence.
sentences.chinese: 厚颜无耻由于愚昧无知。

sentences.english: What knocks me is his impudence.
sentences.chinese: 他的厚颜无耻使我感到吃惊。

sentences.english: We want Japan to know him to be bold-faced, is impossible.
sentences.chinese: 我们要日本知道他是厚颜无耻的，是不可能的。
我对你的厚颜无耻感到惊奇。

sentences.english: She said, you are an illegitimate daughter, also have no shame to find people to support you.
sentences.chinese: 她说，你一个私生女，还厚颜无耻地来找人家养你。

sentences.english: That’s the audacity of hope at full stretch.
sentences.chinese: 这就是他们竭尽全力所希望达到的厚颜无耻之境界。

sentences.english: I was annoyed at his impudence.
She brazened through the accusation from the witness stand.
sentences.chinese: 她厚颜无耻地抵赖证人对她的指控。

sentences.english: Japanese is the nationality with great effrontery.
sentences.chinese: 日本是一个非常厚颜无耻的民族。

definition: to have no sense of shame
to have no sense of shame/shameless
to have no sense of shame/brazen
in the right and self-confident (idiom); bold and confident with justice on one's side/to have the courage of one's convictions/just and forceful
to know no shame/to be totally shameless
to lie through one's teeth (idiom)/to talk drivel
to speak forcefully and with justice (idiom); to argue with the courage of one's convictions
devotion to righteousness that inspires reverence (idiom)
